body_html:
You can connect to the jupiter notebook by doing http://localhost:888
To get to the shell you need to find the process # of the running docker container

docker ps

(this will give a list of running docker instances. Get the sha code (first column) and use it when running

docker exec  -t -i <hash> bash

That should give you a bash shell.
(this is not a tensorflow specific answer)

Let me know if you need additional help.

body:
You can connect to the jupiter notebook by doing http://localhost:888
To get to the shell you need to find the process # of the running docker container

```
docker ps 
```

(this will give a list of running docker instances. Get the sha code (first column) and use it when running

```
docker exec  -t -i <hash> bash
```

That should give you a bash shell.
(this is not a tensorflow specific answer)

Let me know if you need additional help.
